meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

Alright, let's dive into the wonderful world of MultiVersus! This platform fighter has been generating a lot of buzz lately, and I'm excited to share my thoughts on it.

First off, the game is all about team-based combat. You'll be paired up with another character from the vast Warner Bros. universe (think Batman, Wonder Woman, Bugs Bunny, and more) to take down your opponents in a series of matches. It's a lot of fun, especially when you find a pair that works well together.

But here's the thing: MultiVersus isn't just about bashing each other with special moves. No sir, it's got some serious depth to it. Each character has their own unique abilities, strengths, and weaknesses that'll require strategy and coordination to fully utilize.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "Is this game a Smash Bros. clone?" Well, let me tell you, my friend... that term is as annoying as a mosquito at a BBQ (RIP). MultiVersus may share some similarities with the classic Nintendo fighter, but it's got its own thing going on.

And speaking of things going on, the Rifts mode in MultiVersus is actually quite impressive. You get to play through single-player levels, taking down hordes of enemies while collecting power-ups and upgrades. It's a nice change of pace from the standard multiplayer fare.

Now, I know some of you might be thinking, "But what about the Battle Pass progression? Is it as grindy as everyone says?" Well, let me tell you, my friend... yes. Yes it is. But hey, at least the rewards are worth it (mostly).

In all seriousness, MultiVersus is a solid game that's definitely worth checking out, especially if you're a fan of platform fighters or Warner Bros. properties. And hey, who knows? You might just find your new favorite character to play as!

So there you have it, folks! That's my take on MultiVersus. What do you think? Are you excited to jump into the world of this game? Let me know in the comments below!
